abstract.p: Former San Francisco 49er quarterback Steve Young has joined board of Flexpoint; is expanding his role as chairman of Found.com and is forming joint venture, FirstLight Venture Capital, a technology investment firm; photo (M)

block.p: Whether scrambling away from defenders or bowling into the end zone, Steve Young, the quick-footed quarterback of the San Francisco 49ers, never could keep still. Now he is retired, and moving faster than ever.

A day after he bid farewell to football in mid-June, Mr. Young was drafted again, this time for the board of Flexpoint, a company based in Salt Lake City that makes sensors for cars and toys. Before the week was up, Mr. Young gleefully talked about expanding his role as chairman of Found.com, a somewhat obscure e-marketplace based in San Francisco, in which he was the first investor.

Whether scrambling away from defenders or bowling into the end zone, Steve Young, the quick-footed quarterback of the San Francisco 49ers, never could keep still. Now he is retired, and moving faster than ever.

A day after he bid farewell to football in mid-June, Mr. Young was drafted again, this time for the board of Flexpoint, a company based in Salt Lake City that makes sensors for cars and toys. Before the week was up, Mr. Young gleefully talked about expanding his role as chairman of Found.com, a somewhat obscure e-marketplace based in San Francisco, in which he was the first investor.

Two weeks later, the news spread that Mr. Young had teamed up with Novell's former senior vice president and general counsel, David Bradford, to form FirstLight Venture Capital, a technology investment firm. The N.F.L.'s greatest running quarterback, who once tossed paychecks into a sock drawer and kept signing bonuses crumpled in a jeans pocket, was dashing head first into the new economy.

But perhaps just a little too quickly. Mr. Young's associates say the FirstLight announcement came prematurely, before plans for the new company were final. Talks concerning the new venture continued last week.
